name: Introduction to Philosophy
description: This course introduces basic philosophical concepts and ways of thinking. Topics may include epistemology, metaphysics, ethics, logic, and social/political philosophy.

name: Logic
description: This course explores the principles and techniques of logic. Topics may include logical argumentation, deductive and inductive reasoning, and the study of fallacies.

name: Epistemology
description: This course examines theories of knowledge and their philosophical implications. Topics may include skepticism, justification, and the analysis of knowledge.

name: Metaphysics
description: This course explores the fundamental nature of reality. Topics may include ontology, causation, free will, and the nature of space and time.

name: Ethics
description: This course examines ethical theories and the application of those theories to real-world moral issues. Topics may include consequentialism, deontological ethics, and virtue ethics.

name: Philosophy of Science
description: This course explores fundamental questions about the nature of science and scientific knowledge. Topics may include the scientific method, causation, and scientific explanation.

name: Philosophy of Mind
description: This course examines the nature of consciousness and mental processes. Topics may include intentionality, subjective experience, and the mind-body problem.

name: Existentialism and Phenomenology
description: This course examines major figures and themes in 20th century existentialist and phenomenological philosophy. Topics may include authenticity, freedom, and the nature of existence.
